prompt: How do ski resorts decide how fast to run their chair lifts? What is the optimal speed? How can that be increased? What are the tradeoffs?
title: Determining Optimal Chairlift Speed at Ski Resorts
sceneDescription: A lone lift operator stands at the control booth near the top of a snowy peak, examining a large lever marked with a progression of simple icons ranging from a tiny snail to a soaring rocket. Behind the operator, an impatient row of bundled-up skiers and snowboarders waits, some tapping boots anxiously. Far below, another group wobbles aboard the slow, swinging chairs. Overhead, the haul rope stretches across the frosty expanse. The operator’s posture suggests a delicate balancing act, ready to nudge the lever—yet holding fast to caution in the thin mountain air.
